chargeHist.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carrie A. Steinmetz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carrie A. Steinmetz was found guilty of Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Carrie A. Steinmetz was found guilty of Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

04:12 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Drengler also appears on behalf of defendant for case 14cf86.  Calling 14cf61 and 14cf86.  State moves to amend Count 1 in 14cf61 to 961.41(3g)(b) - Granted.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Drengler/Finlan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence 14cf61 and 14cf86 Cts 3 and 4
WHS/POP 3 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge (1 ct only)/Supervision Fees
No contact with Mr. Johnson
Engage in mental health treatment
Jail - 60 days  in 14cf86 only CC - W/Huber for all purposes 
Jail credit 4 days in case 14cf61
Jail credit 141 days in case 14cf86
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
DPA Filed
No contact w/Thomas Franz lifted - all other bond conditions remain.

03:16 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss Count 1 and amend Count 3 to 948.09 - Sex with a child age 16 or older a Class A Misdemeanor - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire and DPA filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of counts 3 and 4 but defers judgment and accepts the DPA for count 2.  Drengler requests adjournment for sentencing.  Drengler statement to bond modification requesting no contact provision with Thomas Franz be lifted - Granted.  Bail continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
State's Reply to Discovery continued

03:30 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler, appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Schiek states an Information has not been filed - State will file Information that will mirror criminal complaint.  Drengler will proceed with the understanding that Information will mirror complaint and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

11:32 am - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Court informs Drengler he may appear telephonically at the arraignment to enter pleas.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

03:34 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler, appearing telephonically.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.

No contact WHATSOEVER with Z.M.S.  No contact with Co-defendants - Michael Johnson or Thomas Franz - Court leaves cash bond in place but will provide if defendant is unable to post cash bond - defendant may leave jail to participate in inpatient treatment until completed or discharged.  Defendant may not leave Koinonia facilty for any off-site treatment.

02:48 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court,via video, in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Court indicates defendant has applied for PD appointment and PD's office is working on appointment of counsel.  Steinmetz/Schiek statement to letters/motion to modify bond.  Court leaves cash bond in place but will provide if defendant is unable to post cash bond - defendant may leave jail to participate in inpatient treatment until completed or discharged.  Defendant may not leave Koinonia facilty for any off-site treatment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
